### About

I am a Senior Computational Statistician at Eli Lilly, responsible for data processing and analysis of early-phase clinical trials in immunology and internal medicine. I earned my Master’s degree in Biostatistics from Columbia University, where I worked under the guidance of [Dr. Ying Wei](https://www.publichealth.columbia.edu/profile/ying-wei-phd), [Dr. Tianying Wang](https://tianyingw.github.io/), [Dr. Bin Cheng](https://www.columbia.edu/~bc2159/index.html), [Dr. Min Qian](https://www.columbia.edu/%7Emq2158/index.html), and [Dr. Annie Lee](https://blogs.cuit.columbia.edu/ajl2199/). Previously, I received a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics from Shandong University in China and graduated with First-Class Honors in Mathematics from the University of Manchester in the UK.



### Research Interests

&bull; High-dimensional Data; Heterogeneity in Common Conditions; Multi-omics Integration; 

&bull; Adaptive Design; 

&bull; Bayesian Methods; 

&bull; Transfer Learning
